page.title: 15A day in the life of..old.
page.content: Mr Maitland Kerr, aged 8l, lives alone in a rented 3-apartment cottage flat. He has no close relatives, no home help, and looks after himself, in spite of breaking his back in North Africa during the war and being completely blind for the last six months due to cataracts. He usually wakens at 7 a.m. He studies Physical Culture and exercises each morning. He then makes a hearty breakfast of porridge, egg and bread. Every day, summer and winter, he goes out for long walks. After lunch he visits friends, one of whom has a broken shoulder bone at present. Sometimes he does some gardening and he is a keen rose grower. After tea if he is not out visiting he spends his evenings reading and listening to classical music before going to bed at midnight.
